response.name: /org [PATCH]
response.body:
{
  "countryCodes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "enableExternalPasswordChange": true,
  "enableAutomaticPasswordReplay": true,
  "enableAutomationGeneration": true,
  "kbaReqAnswers": 0,
  "kbaReqForAuthn": 0,
  "lockoutAttemptThreshold": 0,
  "lockoutTimeMinutes": 0,
  "loginUrl": "string",
  "netmasks": [
    "string"
  ],
  "notifyAuthenticationSettingChange": true,
  "passwordReplayState": "enabled",
  "preferredIdentityInviteTemplate": "string",
  "redirectPatterns": [
    "string"
  ],
  "ssoPartnerSource": "string",
  "systemNotificationEmails": [
    "user@example.com"
  ],
  "trackAnalytics": true,
  "usageCertRequired": true,
  "usageCertText": "string",
  "usernameEmptyText": "string",
  "usernameLabel": "string",
  "whiteList": true,
  "approvalConfig": {
    "daysTillEscalation": 0,
    "daysBetweenReminders": 0,
    "maxReminders": 0,
    "fallbackApprover": "string"
  }
}

query.description: Search filters. Supported operators are 'co', 'sw', 'eq', 'or', 'and', 'gt', 'lt', 'ge', 'le', 'ne', 'not' and 'pr' which are SCIM-compliant. Supported attributes for filtering are ‘operation’, ’name’, ‘sourceName’ and ‘status’. Example: 'property eq "value"'.

One or more attributes on which to sort each separated by a ','. Prefix the attribute name with a minus sign (ex. -dateCreated) for descending sort. Supported attributes for sorting are 'operation', 'name', 'sourceName' ,'status', 'dateCreated' and 'lastUpdated'.
Paging offset. (Default value: 0)
Paging limit. (Default value: 250)

response.name: /access-requests [POST]

query.description: The identity that the activity was requested for. me indicates the current user. Mutually exclusive with regarding-identity.
The identity that requested the activity. me indicates the current user. Mutually exclusive with regarding-identity.
The specified identity will be either the requester or target of the account activity. me indicates the current user. Mutually exclusive with requested-for and requested-by.
The type of account activity.

Max number of results to return. See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: 250)

Offset into the full result set. Usually specified with limit to paginate through the results.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: 0)

If true it will populate the X-Total-Count response header with the number of results that would be returned if limit and offset were ignored. Since requesting a total count can have a performance impact, it is recommended not to send count=true if that value will not be used.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: false)

Filter results using the standard syntax described in V3 API Standard Collection Paramters https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. Filtering is supported for the following fields and operators: type: eq, in. created: gt, lt, ge, le. modified: gt, lt, ge, le

Sort results using the standard syntax described in V3 API Standard Collection Parameters.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. Sorting is supported for the following fields: type, created, modified.

query.description:
If present, the value returns only requestable objects for the specified identity.

Admin users can call this with any identity ID value.
Non-admin users can only specify me or pass their own identity ID value.
If absent, returns a list of all requestable objects for the tenant. Only admin users can make such a call. In this case, the available, pending, assigned accesses will not be annotated in the result.

Filters the results to the specified type/types, where each type is one of ROLE or ACCESS_PROFILE. If absent, all types are returned. Support for additional types may be added in the future without notice.

Available values : ACCESS_PROFILE, ROLE

Filters the result to the specified status/statuses, where each status is one of AVAILABLE, ASSIGNED, or PENDING. It is an error to specify this parameter without also specifying an identity-id parameter. Additional statuses may be added in the future without notice.

Available values : AVAILABLE, PENDING, ASSIGNED

Max number of results to return. See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: 250)

Offset into the full result set. Usually specified with limit to paginate through the results.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: 0)

If true it will populate the X-Total-Count response header with the number of results that would be returned if limit and offset were ignored. Since requesting a total count can have a performance impact, it is recommended not to send count=true if that value will not be used.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. (Default value: false)

Filter results using the standard syntax described in V3 API Standard Collection Paramters https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. Filtering is supported for the following fields and operators: type: eq, in. created: gt, lt, ge, le. modified: gt, lt, ge, le

Sort results using the standard syntax described in V3 API Standard Collection Parameters.  See V3 API Standard Collection Parameters for more information: https://community.sailpoint.com/t5/IdentityNow-Wiki/V3-API-Standard-Collection-Parameters/ta-p/156407. Sorting is supported for the following fields: type, created, modified.

request.description:
This gets a collection of account activities that satisfy the given query parameters.

[{
id	string
example: 2c9180835d2e5168015d32f890ca1581
ID of the account activity itself

name	string
example: 2c9180835d2e5168015d32f890ca1581
created	string($date-time)
example: 2017-07-11T18:45:37.098Z
modified	string($date-time)
example: 2018-06-25T20:22:28.104Z
completed	string($date-time)
example: 2018-10-19T13:49:37.385Z
completionStatus	string
Enum:
Array [ 4 ]
type	string
example: appRequest
requesterIdentitySummary	{...}
targetIdentitySummary	{...}
errors	[...]
warnings	[...]
items	[...]
executionStatus	string
Enum:
Array [ 4 ]
clientMetadata	{...}
}]

Allowed filter properties: owner.id, public

Example filters:

owner.id eq "0de46054-fe90-434a-b84e-c6b3359d0c64" -- returns saved searches for the specified owner ID

public eq true -- returns all public saved searches

owner.id eq me or public eq true -- returns all of the current user's saved searches as well as all public saved searches belonging to other users in the current org

This gets a collection of account activities that satisfy the given query parameters.

[{
id	string
example: 2c9180835d2e5168015d32f890ca1581
ID of the account activity itself

name	string
example: 2c9180835d2e5168015d32f890ca1581
created	string($date-time)
example: 2017-07-11T18:45:37.098Z
modified	string($date-time)
example: 2018-06-25T20:22:28.104Z
completed	string($date-time)
example: 2018-10-19T13:49:37.385Z
completionStatus	string
Enum:
Array [ 4 ]
type	string
example: appRequest
requesterIdentitySummary	{...}
targetIdentitySummary	{...}
errors	[...]
warnings	[...]
items	[...]
executionStatus	string
Enum:
Array [ 4 ]
clientMetadata	{...}
}]

List campaign templates.

Create a Campaign Template

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/createCampaignTemplate

response.name: /access-request-status [GET] [BETA] Copy

request.description:
List campaign templates.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/listCampaignTemplates

Allows updating individual fields on a campaign template using the JSON Patch standard.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/patchCampaignTemplate

Deletes a campaign template by ID.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/deleteCampaignTemplate

Generates a new campaign from a campaign template. The campaign object contained in the template has special formatting applied to its name and description fields in order to determine the generated campaign's name/description. Placeholders in those fields are formatted with the current date and time upon generation. Placeholders consist of a percent sign followed by a letter indicating what should be inserted; for example, "%Y" will insert the current year; a campaign template named "Campaign for %y" would generate a campaign called "Campaign for 2020" (assuming the year at generation time is 2020). Valid placeholders are the date/time conversion suffix characters supported by java.util.Formatter.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/generateCampaignTemplate

Gets the schedule for a campaign template. Returns a 404 if there is no schedule set.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/getCampaignTemplateSchedule

Gets the schedule for a campaign template. Returns a 404 if there is no schedule set.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/getCampaignTemplateSchedule

Deletes the schedule for a campaign template. Returns a 404 if there is no schedule set.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/deleteCampaignTemplateSchedule

List campaign templates.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/listCampaignTemplates

List campaign templates.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Campaign%20Templates/listCampaignTemplates

query.description:
If present, the value returns only requestable objects for the specified identity.

Admin users can call this with any identity ID value.
Non-admin users can only specify me or pass their own identity ID value.
If absent, returns a list of all requestable objects for the tenant. Only admin users can make such a call. In this case, the available, pending, assigned accesses will not be annotated in the result.

Filters the results to the specified type/types, where each type is one of ROLE or ACCESS_PROFILE. If absent, all types are returned. Support for additional types may be added in the future without notice.

Available values : ACCESS_PROFILE, ROLE

Filters the result to the specified status/statuses, where each status is one of AVAILABLE, ASSIGNED, or PENDING. It is an error to specify this parameter without also specifying an identity-id parameter. Additional statuses may be added in the future without notice.

Available values : AVAILABLE, PENDING, ASSIGNED

request.description:
This end-point gets a specific source in IdentityNow.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Sources/getSource

This API updates a source in IdentityNow, using a full object representation. In other words, the existing Source configuration is completely replaced. Some fields are immutable and cannot be changed, such as:

id * created * modified * type * connector * connectorClass Attempts to modify these fields will result in a 400 error.

https://api.identitynow.com/?urls.primaryName=Beta#/Sources/replaceSource

response.name: /sources/{id} [PUT] [BETA]

response.body:
{
  "id": "2c9180835d191a86015d28455b4a2329",
  "name": "account",
  "nativeObjectType": "User",
  "identityAttribute": "sAMAccountName",
  "displayAttribute": "distinguishedName",
  "hierarchyAttribute": "memberOf",
  "includePermissions": false,
  "features": [
    "PROVISIONING",
    "NO_PERMISSIONS_PROVISIONING",
    "GROUPS_HAVE_MEMBERS"
  ],
  "configuration": {
    "groupMemberAttribute": "member"
  },
  "attributes": [
    {
      "name": "sAMAccountName",
      "type": "string",
      "isMultiValued": false,
      "isEntitlement": false,
      "isGroup": false
    },
    {
      "name": "memberOf",
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Group membership",
      "isMultiValued": true,
      "isEntitlement": true,
      "isGroup": true
    }
  ],
  "created": "2019-12-24T22:32:58.104Z",
  "modified": "2019-12-31T20:22:28.104Z"
}

id

query.description:
Max number of results to return.

Default value : 250

Offset into the full result set. Usually specified with limit to paginate through the results.

Default value : 0

If true it will populate the X-Total-Count response header with the number of results that would be returned if limit and offset were ignored.

Since requesting a total count can have a performance impact, it is recommended not to send count=true if that value will not be used.
